newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Basque ETA wing fights Spanish court order.
newsitem.headline: Basque ETA wing fights Spanish court order.

text.p: The political arm of the Basque separatist ETA guerilla organisation said in Brussels on Friday it would not comply with Spain's Supreme Court summons to answer charges members had promoted violence.
"We do not recognise the legality of this audience (Supreme Court) so we will not make any declarations there," Karmelo Landa, a leading member of Herri Batasuna (HB), told a news conference.

The Supreme Court has summoned the entire leadership of Herri Batasuna to appear on Monday on charges members edited and distributed an ETA (Basque Homeland and Freedom) videotape during the general election campaign last March.

Landa said some HB members would be in Belgium to protest against Leuven University's decision to give Spain's King, Juan Carlos I, an honorary doctorate. Juan Carlos is due to receive the award on Monday.
"The same day that the King receives an honorary degree the state starts in Madrid a political process to imprison 24 members of HB," Landa said.
"We say the decision of the Supreme Court is a political decision...(and) an attack against the freedom of speech and right to inform," said HB spokesman Sabin Del Bado.
"For the Basques, the King represents the oppression by the Spanish State of the Basque country," Del Bado added.
ETA has killed some 800 people since 1968 in its drive for Basque independence.
Security is expected to be heightened at Leuven University on Monday, where some students are also expected to demonstrate against the Spanish King's award, a University spokeswoman told Reuters.
